alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Northern Herkimer; Schoharie; Southern Herkimer; Western Greene (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 14 at 3:28PM EST until January 17 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON EST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 to 35 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches with locally higher totals possible. Winds could gust as high as 30 to 45 mph. * WHERE...The Southern Green Mountains of southern Vermont, The Berkshires of western Massachusetts, the western Adirondacks, western Mohawk Valley, Schoharie County, and western Greene County of eastern New York. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 7 PM this evening to noon EST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday evening through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Hamilton; Northern Herkimer; Schoharie; Southern Herkimer; Western Greene
